climbs.name: Warm-up
climbs.fa: unknown (I'm sure someone has done this before me)

content.description: This is an easy warm-up on fun, huge holds. The crux is the start :)
content.protection: There is a good landing. A pad is nice.
content.location: On the upper boulder, climb the obvious, easy crack system on the East-facing side. This is just to the right of the face with the large, horizontal crack system seen when approaching the boulder from the road.
The start uses opposing sidepulls at/above head height.

content.description: Climb small crimps up the face. The starting holds are at/above head height.
content.location: To find this block, go up Vasquez Road, take a right on 159, and just before you get to the top of the hill where D4 is on your right, there is an unmarked single-track trail on your left called Pinball. Take this trail for about ten minutes, and you will find the boulder. There is a corridor on the east-ish side of the boulder where the problem 'Murmurs' awaits.

content.description: On the Pinball Boulder, ascend the slab facing the trail.
content.location: This ascends the slab that faces the trail.

content.description:
Climb using opposing, blocky sidepulls. This route is just left of

Coinage

.
content.location: It is on the Pinball Boulder.

content.description: Jellyfish is a moderate boulder problem on SW corner. The route kind of faces the road. The entire boulder only has one route to date.
content.location: See the map, but generally speaking, it is 1/2 way back to WP from the Sanitation Station on the left side of the road.

climbs.name: Hollow Triangle
climbs.fa: unknown (I'm sure someone has done this before me)

content.description: Climb crimps to the top. The hollow triangular hold is the defining feature of this problem.
content.protection: There are nice places for pads :)
content.location: On the upper boulder, this is the line just to the right of the large spoon formation on the North-facing side.

climbs.name: Dipper
climbs.fa: unknown (I'm sure someone has done this before me)

content.description: Climb the obvious spoon feature directly. The crux is at the top with crimps and slopers on the right side.
content.location:
On the upper boulder on the North side, this is just to the left of

Hollow Triangle

.
